DOC.brief_summary: Background : Smoking counsel hospitalisation post-discharge follow-up increase quit . However , provision cessation care hospitalise patient suboptimal . Students potentially untapped resource provide cessation advice , study investigate . Aim : To determine medical student encourage motivation stop smoking ( MTSS ; primary outcome ) hospitalise smoker . Design : 2-arm RCT Setting : RCSI ( www.rcsi.ie ) Connolly Hospital ( www.hse.ie/eng/services/list/3/hospitals/Connolly/ ) . Participants : Inpatient smoker . Intervention procedure : 60 graduate medical student receive standardise motivational interview train provision cessation advice . Each student randomly assign counsel ~1-3 smoker , include individual in-hospital , face-to-face session post-discharge phone counselling . Training implementation cover Sept-2015-May-2016 . Smokers randomise 'usual care ' ( n~90 ) , intervention ( n~90 , student-delivered motivational interviewing ) . A researcher enable recruitment follow-up , conduct qualitative evaluation programme participant .
